Open Source Git Management Software

Gitlab is open source software to collaborate on code. Manage git repositories with fine grained access controls that keep your code secure. Perform code reviews and enhance collaboration with merge requests. Each project can also have an issue tracker and a wiki. Used by more than 50,000 organizations, GitLab is the most popular solution to manage git repositories on-premises.

The community site for GitLab and the source code for the Community Edition can be found on GitLab.org:
GitLab Community Edition

 

GitLab.com is co-founded by the lead author of GitLab to offer commercial services for GitLab. We offer subscriptions, consulting and a free SaaS service called GitLab Cloud as well as:
GitLab Enterprise Edition

GitLab Services

Subscription

A subscription includes access to GitLab Enterprise Edition and support.

Consultancy

Hire us to help you.

Cloud

Use GitLab without installing anything.


Used in more than 25,000 organizations


GitLab Features

Below are some highlights, a complete list is available on the feature comparison page.

Repository Access

Extended permission system with 5 access levels and branch protection.

Administration

Simplify management by creating groups of projects and teams of users.

Issues

Use the ticketing system included in GitLab or integrate your existing system.

Code Review

Learn from eachother by leaving line comments in the diff.

Wiki

Each project has a wiki backed up by a separate git repository.

Merge Requests

Work in git branches for a more efficient workflow.


"My department has been using GitLab since version 1.0 and have found that it's a good code sharing platform that keeps getting better with each release. GitLab fills our need and desire for such code sharing capability while at the same time satisfying the organizations direction that University intellectual property not be placed on public cloud-based services outside of campus."

Troy Murray
Information Technologist II - Michigan State University

 

"Gitlab is an excellent option..... not only more user friendly than Gitorious but also easier to install."

Hongli Lai
Phusion - makers of Passenger, the most popular ruby application server
